repnme.cdata!: Malawi - Transport Engineering and Services Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project is the next preparatory step
            of the Borrower's program to develop and prepare a wood
            processing scheme based on the forest resources of the
            Viphya plateau. A prefeasibility study, financed by UNDP and
            executed by IBRD, concluded that the establishment of a
            pulpmill at Chinteche would be the most economical
            alternative. More detailed studies on cost and engineering
            of various aspects of the scheme are, however, required. In
            addition, technical assistance will be required to enable
            Malawi to identify and secure financial, technical, and
            commercial partners to carry out the scheme. A preparation
            program has been drawn up jointly between the Government,
            UNDP, FAO, the United Kingdom and IDA, who would participate
            in financing and executing this program.
